content: this is dmg and we're making a crate all right so we're gonna make some
crates these are you'll find all kinds of different versions on how to do this
on the forums and stuff this is my version this is about the seventh
attempt so we're gonna grab this cardstock and a whole bunch of
matchsticks and we're gonna just mark halfway across these matchsticks now
obvious it depends on the length of your matchsticks mine are five centimeters
which is about two inches and measure halfway across I'm kind of eyeballing it
so this is an extremely precision measurement here so I've got a whole
bunch in half and then I hot-glued two ends of one and of course I've got the
what they called parchment paper in the US I think it is baking paper in
Australia and I think in the UK as well so that the hot glue does not stick to
the surface so I'm then applying hot glue as you can see I stuck two of the
half matchsticks to the original piece and then hot glue on the end and place
another crossbar so that easily comes off the baking paper and then we apply
some hot glue on the back and stick it to the corner of the thin cardstock so
be very careful not to burn yourself in this and there's a reason why we didn't
just put it on the cardstock because this is going to have other things stuck
inside so then just trim off the cardboard so we've got one flat panel
now I grab another matchstick and we're going to measure a support key or a
cross bar I suppose it's called and technical terms are not my thing at the
moment and which place a diagonal line of hot glue across and stick in that
cross beam so now we have a pallet panel and then on the back where my cardboard
sign we're going to put a dot of hot glue in each corner and stick two bits
of the half matchsticks vertically and then applies and hot glue to the top
and then also across the top we will then place a half matchstick now of
course you're starting to think yourself well you know gee why don't you just
create the panels and then stick them together trust me it starts to get
really complicated you can try it yourself and see you know with starts to
change and all kinds of stuff so that's kind of why I'm just eyeballing it and
doing it this way after six or seven attempts this is probably the easiest
way for me to demonstrate it to you without giving you all kinds of
Pythagorean formulas so again we're just gonna put in a cross bar and I'm gonna
cut another strip of cardboard the same width of the original one and we're now
going to apply that to the back of the second panel so just eyeballing the
measurement there terminal for some scissors apply hot glue to the back of
the panel so that now the inside of the crate and stick down the cardboard so I
originally attempted this with wood sticks and it was an absolute nightmare
in fact I have done a dmg lab episode which will be in my new channel soon and
you'll be able to check out my successes and failures on a wide range of
experiments so again on the bit on the back of the cardboard we get into stick
two dollops of hot glue and then two vertical matchsticks half matchsticks
and then across the top again and then we can apply hot glue on the insides of
those top ones there and then apply a cross beam across and then do that on
the other side so again this you know you can attempt to build the panel's
first but it does require a lot of measuring to get it all right
so that things fit properly and it's yeah it's a lot of math survivors don't
want to do so which is eyeballing here again for the strips and now we're going
to put the hot glue along the inside edge of the
one side so one of the edges and put the piece of cardboard inside there on the
inside and push it forward so we are now have the panels on the inside and we're
basically going to repeat this process all the way around except for one side
so one side will remain open it will eventually close that but it's a matter
of being able to assemble the damn thing so this is why we didn't apply the
crossbeams first so you can actually get your fingers in there and actually stick
the things down easily and if there's any sort of cardboard sticking over you
can just trim it with a pair of scissors or craft knife or something so finally
we're just applying the last little panel here and so that will go in
through the open and the final open side and just again be careful of the hot
glue because it is hot and just move it around a little bit and get it all
nicely in place so this does seem like a you know quite a mission to do but you
know the effect is quite nice and you can scale this to any size so this is
effectively creating a one inch cube crate which is nice just about mini half
mini high to three quarter of mini hearts I mean you can stand minis on
them and that sort of thing so it's a relatively playable service you can
essentially just create the two inch cubed ones by not cutting matchsticks
you may have a bit of a problem with the cross beings which I'm now applying
because they will need slightly longer matchsticks if you want to know why try
Pythagoras so now it's final struggle hot glue diagonally and there we have
all the sides now have braces on them and we've got one side open so what
we're going to do now is going to close that side and we're not going to put a
brace on that side so that will effectively be the bottom so
what I'm doing when I'm painting it we will just leave the bottom black so that
it's easily identify her as at the bottom of the crate now another reason
for this is if you did want to open it and put stuff in for weight or you just
wanted to you know actually put stuff inside the crate and have an open side
or whatever you can essentially just rip that off quite easily and continue on
and just need to paint the interior so there we have it
I've now black bombed it with black matte black spray-paint I'm just going
to apply Brown acrylic paint and then I'm gonna do a mixture of yellow in the
brown and sort of a witty dry brush they would be sirs you know that had a little
bit more yellow and then just dab into the panels and just do some streaks to
kind of look like the wood inside so that is effectively it so that is a
crate it doesn't take very long to do but there are a hundred different
methods of doing it so that's how we make a crate sorry so if you liked this
